comments.body: did you see if this generates a warning when building the docs? we may need to use this syntax if that's the case: https://docs.python.org/3/library/doctest.html (see `Traceback`...)

This throws an indention error and then an undefined error when the df1 and df2 gets indented (to aling with the if df: above I think.  Since df1, df2, s1, and s2 are never defined I wasn't sure how to proceed.  Should I define them or follow the traceback approach?
I ended up assigning the variables, let me know if you'd like to see an alternative solution...

diffHunk:

     a.bool(), a.item(), a.any() or a.all().
